meanings.sent1: Her haet towards broccoli made her refuse to eat it.
meanings.sent2: The haet between the two rival teams was palpable.
meanings.sent3: Despite his haet for early mornings, he had to wake up for work.
meanings.sent4: The haet in the air was so thick, you could almost touch it.
meanings.sent5: The child's haet for vegetables was legendary in the family.

meanings.definition: To feel intense or passionate dislike towards someone or something
meanings.sent1: She would haet going to the dentist every six months.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't help but haet the taste of cilantro in his food.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to haet the new scratching post more than the old one.
meanings.sent4: His haet for public speaking was so strong, he avoided it at all costs.
meanings.sent5: The teacher could sense the students' haet for pop quizzes.
